bill.title: Office of Elections Package; Permanent Absentee Ballots
bill.description: Specifies the in-state mailing address in a voter's registration record as the forwarding address for receiving absentee ballots permanently. Requires voters seeking to have permanent absentee ballots forwarded to another address to re-apply for an absentee ballot. (HB179 CD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Passed First Reading
Referred to JUD, referral sheet 1
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Friday, 01-30-15 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 11 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, San Buenaventura, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Takayama, Woodson, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; Noes: none; and 4 Excused: Representative(s) Belatti, Cachola, Nakashima, Thielen.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 57) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1; placed on the calendar for Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Har, Matsumoto excused (2).
Passed Third Reading with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) C. Lee excused (1). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 9).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-16-15 9:30AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 5 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Espero, Gabbard, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 2 Excused: Senator(s) Ihara, L. Thielen.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 961) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.

House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).

The Conference Committee recommends that the measure be Passed, with Amendments. The votes were as follows: 4 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Brower, San Buenaventura, McDermott; Ayes with reservations: none; 0 Noes: none; and 0 Excused: none.
Reported from Conference Committee (Conf Com. Rep. No. 23) as amended in (CD 1).

48 Hrs. Notice (as amended CD 1) 05-05-15.
Passed Final Reading, as amended (CD 1). 25 Aye(s); Aye(s) with reservations: none . 0 No(es): none. 0 Excused: none.
